block.p: 2 Sides Subdued in Mideast With the Camp David summit meeting to begin on Tuesday, both sides in the Middle East feared having their hopes dashed again.
2 Sides Subdued in Mideast With the Camp David summit meeting to begin on Tuesday, both sides in the Middle East feared having their hopes dashed again.
Debating Access to Drugs The battle over costs and access to drugs is a backdrop to the AIDS conference in South Africa.
Lutheran-Episcopal Alliance An alliance between the denominations won final approval, and could lead to other joint efforts.
Putin's State of the Nation President Vladimir V. Putin assembled Parliament and a national television audience to present his assessment of the state of Russia. In a word, it was forbidding.
A Magic Moment Arrives In a night of bedtime amnesty, children and parents across the country lined up until just after midnight to be among the first to buy the new Harry Potter book.

On the Road Again From a Midwestern campus to the borders of Iraq, the hero of ''The Name of the World,'' Denis Johnson's new novel, explores the uses of flight and renewal after overwhelming loss; reviewed by Robert Stone.
Rem Koolhaas Builds The architect's designs were once considered too radical to build. Not anymore.
Pastoral Ireland Wildflowers soften the the Burren's limestone cliffs, and neighboring Gort inspires affection.
